head.supplied: 20/1/90 ¶ ¶ This day, dear Chevalier Archer, I received the Circular, concerning the intended last homage to the Rev. Julian Tenison Woods, by his friends. Kindly say, what likely will be subscribed ...

div.p: 2/137/15, Archer papers, University of Melbourne Archives.

This day, dear Chevalier Archer, I received the Circular, concerning the intended last homage to the Rev. Julian Tenison Woods, by his friends. Kindly say, what likely will be subscribed by the generality of the contributors, that I may send my mite accordingly.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
You spoke splendidly in the sanitary section.
Archer is not listed as having presented a paper at the Congress of the Australasian Association for the Advancement of Science held in Melbourne, 7-13 January 1890, but he may well have contributed to the discussions in Section H, 'Sanitary Science and Hygiene'.
